elements.name: cloudEnvironment
elements.label: Select cloud environment

elements.name: selection
elements.label: Azure cloud environment
elements.defaultValue: [if(contains(steps('basics').resourceScope.location.name, 'china'), 'Azure China Cloud', if(contains(steps('basics').resourceScope.location.name, 'usgov'), 'Azure US Government', if(contains(steps('basics').resourceScope.location.name, 'usdod'), 'Azure US Government', 'Azure Cloud')))]
elements.toolTip: Select your target Azure cloud environment.

options.text: This value should be automatically set based on the list of available locations. Only change this if you believe the value to be incorrect.

body.query: ResourceContainers | where type =~ 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions' | where properties.state =~ 'enabled' | project label=tostring(name), description=subscriptionId, value=subscriptionId | order by label asc

policyresources | where type == 'microsoft.authorization/policysetdefinitions' | extend metadataCategory=tostring(properties.metadata.category) | extend metadataDeprecated=tostring(properties.metadata.deprecated) | extend displayName=tostring(properties.displayName) | extend description=tostring(properties.description) | where properties.metadata.category =~ 'Regulatory Compliance' | where metadataDeprecated != 'true' |  extend valueOutput=pack('displayName', displayName, 'id', id, 'description', description) | project id, name, displayName, description, metadataCategory, valueOutput | project label=displayName, description, value=valueOutput | order by label asc

subLabel.preValidation: Provide a company prefix for the management group structure that will be created.

options.text: Azure Landing Zones ARM deployment requires access at the tenant root (/) scope. Visit this link to ensure you have the appropriate RBAC permission to complete the deployment
Azure Landing Zones will create the management group hierarchy under the Tenant Root Group with the prefix provided at this step.

This deployment will create the ALZ default Management Group hierarchy with Names/IDs that are documented in the FAQ (click on this box to be taken to this page). If you have existing Management Groups that have the same Names/IDs these will be targeted in the ALZ deployment (click on this box to find out how to handle this or to see what will happen)

elements.name: enterpriseScaleCompanyPrefix
elements.label: Resource prefix (Root ID)
elements.toolTip: Provide a resource prefix (max 10 characters, unique at tenant-scope). This will be used for the Management Group hierarchy and other resources created as part of this deployment.

elements.name: platformSubscription
elements.label: Platform subscription options
elements.toolTip: If 'Dedicated (recommended)' is selected, dedicated Subscriptions will be used for deploying connectivity, identity and management resources. Select Single for testing purposes where all roles will be deployed in a single subscription.

elements.name: singleSubscription
elements.label: Single platform subscription

options.text: Dedicated subscriptions are recommended for the different platform resource categories to ensure scale, sustainability, and segregation of duties. A single subscription can be used for proof of concepts, or by smaller organizations.
Select a single subscription that will be used for all platform resources. This includes resources relating to platform management, security, governance, automation, connectivity, and identity.

elements.name: selector
elements.label: Platform subscription

elements.name: deploySecondaryRegion
elements.label: Deploy in a secondary region
elements.toolTip: If you select Yes, you will be prompted to deploy resources in an additional region where appropriate.

elements.name: denyClassicResources
elements.label: Prevent the deployment of classic resources
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected then Azure Policy will prevent deployment of classic resources which will be retired on 31 August 2024.
Uses the policy Not allowed resource types with parameters including all classic resources.

elements.name: denyVMUnmanagedDisk
elements.label: Prevent the deployment of virtual machines and virtual machine scale sets with unmanaged disks
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected then Azure Policy will prevent deployment of virtual machines and virtual machine scales sets with unmanaged disks.
Uses the policy Audit VMs that do not use managed disks using a Deny override.

elements.name: cuaSection
elements.label: Telemetry Tracking Using Customer Usage Attribution (PID)

options.text: Microsoft can identify the deployments of the Azure Resource Manager templates with the deployed Azure resources. Microsoft collects this information to provide the best experiences with their products and to operate their business. The telemetry is collected through customer usage attribution. The data is collected and governed by Microsoft's privacy policies, located at the trust center. Visit this link to find out more.

elements.name: telemetryOptOut
elements.label: Customer Usage Selection Options

elements.name: esPlatformMgmtGroup
elements.label: Platform Management Group

elements.label: Enforce Key Vault recommended guardrails
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy Initiative will be assigned to ensure recommended Key Vault policies are enabled.
Uses the custom initiative Enforce recommended guardrails for Azure Key Vault..

elements.name: enforceBackupPlat
elements.label: Enforce Backup and Recovery recommended guardrails
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy Initiative will be assigned to ensure recommended Azure Recovery Services policies are enabled.

options.text: To enable platform management, security and governance, you must allocate a management Subscription. Please note, this Subscription will be moved to the platform Management Group, and ARM will deploy a Log Analytics workspace and requisite settings. We recommend using a new Subscription with no existing resources. Note that Azure Policy will be used to govern the configuration for the platform at scale.

To enable platform management, security and governance, you can configure core infra such as Log Analytics, Azure Security Center and additional monitoring solutions to your dedicated platform subscription. Note that Azure Policy will be used to govern the configuration for the platform at scale.

elements.name: enableLogAnalytics
elements.label: Deploy Log Analytics workspace and enable monitoring for your platform and resources
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance.

elements.name: retentionInDays
elements.label: Log Analytics Data Retention (days)
elements.toolTip: Select retention days for Azure logs. Default is 30 days (free retention period). If you are also deploying Microsoft Sentinel, change this to 90 days (free retention for Sentinel).

options.text:
Note: Log Analytics offers two log data plans, Analytics and Basic, that let you reduce log ingestion and retention costs, and archive that let you keep older data at a reduced cost. After deployment, go to the tables menu in the Log Analytics workspace and select the tables you want to archive or set with basic plan.
  • Configure data retention and archive policies in Azure Monitor Logs
  • Set a table's log data plan to Basic or Analytics

options.text: Azure Landing Zones will create ARM automation to deploy baseline alerts automatically as resources are deployed. Note that selecting Yes to the Option 'Deploy one or more Azure Monitor Baseline Alerts', will automatically import all policies and initiatives and will assign the Deploy Azure Monitor Baseline Alerts for Service Health policy initiative at the intermediate root.

elements.name: enableMonitorBaselines
elements.label: Deploy one or more Azure Monitor Baseline Alerts
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected Azure Monitor Baseline Alerts can be enabled for the selected resources. Note that choosing Yes will import all Monitor baseline alerts into your environment, and assign the Deploy Azure Monitor Service Health policy initiative to your designated intermediate root. For more information on what is included in the Service Health initiative please refer to https://aka.ms/amba/alz/wiki under Azure Policy Initiatives and Alert Details

options.text: To enable network topology and connectivity, you must allocate a dedicated connectivity Subscription. Please note, this Subscription will be moved to the connectivity Management Group, and ARM will deploy the first hub virtual network for either a hub and spoke or Virtual WAN  network topology. Additional networking platform resources such as gateways or Azure Firewall can be deployed. We recommend using a new dedicated Subscription with no existing resources.

To enable network topology and connectivity, you can select the preferred networking topology, and deploy this into the dedicated platform subscription. Additional networking platform resources such as gateways or Azure Firewall can also be deployed.

options.text: To enable identity (AuthN/AuthZ) for workloads in landing zones, you must allocate an identity Subscription that is dedicated to host your Active Directory domain controllers. Please note, this Subscription will be moved to the identity Management Group, and ARM will assign the selected policies. We recommend using a new Subscription with no existing resources.
To enable identity (AuthN/AuthZ) for workloads in landing zones, it is recommended to assign specific policies to govern the virtual machines used for Active Directory domain controllers.

elements.name: esIdentity
elements.label: Assign recommended policies to govern identity and domain controllers
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, Azure Policy will be assigned at the scope to govern your identity resources.

elements.name: esIdentitySubSection
elements.label: Identity subscription

options.text: Ensure you select a subscription that is dedicated/unique for Identity. Selecting the same Subscription here for Management or Connectivity will result in a deployment failure. If you want to use a single Subscription for all platform resources, select 'Single' on the 'Azure Core Setup' blade.

elements.name: esIdentitySub
elements.label: Identity subscription

options.text: Select which of the the recommended policies you will assign to your identity management group.

elements.name: denyMgmtPortsForIdentity
elements.label: Prevent inbound management ports from internet
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and prevent inbound management ports (22, 3389) from internet.
Uses the custom policy Management port access from the Internet should be blocked.

elements.name: denySubnetWithoutNsgForIdentity
elements.label: Ensure subnets are associated with NSG
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure NSGs must be associated with subnets being created.
Uses the custom policy Subnets should have a Network Security Group.

elements.name: denyPipForIdentity
elements.label: Prevent usage of public IP
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure public IP resources cannot be created.
Uses the policy Not allowed resource types with parameters including Public IP Address resources.

elements.name: enableVmBackupForIdentity
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMs (Windows & Linux) are enabled for Azure Backup
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and enable Azure Backup on all VMs in the landing zones.
Uses the policy Configure backup on virtual machines without a given tag to a new recovery services vault with a default policy.

elements.name: esIdentityConnectivity
elements.label: Create virtual network and connect to the connectivity hub (optional)?
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected for corp landing zones, ARM will connect the subscriptions to the hub virtual network via VNet peering.

elements.name: identityAddressPrefix
elements.label: Virtual network address space
elements.toolTip: The virtual network's address space, specified as one address prefixes in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24)

validations.message: Invalid CIDR range. The address prefix must be in the range [10,29].

elements.name: esIdentitySecondarySubSection
elements.label: Secondary Region Identity

elements.name: esIdentityConnectivitySecondary
elements.label: Create virtual network and connect to the connectivity hub in your secondary region (optional)?
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected for corp landing zones, ARM will connect the subscriptions to the hub virtual network via VNet peering.

elements.name: identityAddressPrefixSecondary
elements.label: Virtual network address space
elements.toolTip: The secondary virtual network's address space, specified as one address prefixes in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24)

validations.message: Invalid CIDR range. The address prefix must be in the range [10,29].

options.text: You can optionally provide subscriptions for your first landing zones for both 'online' and 'corp' and assign recommended policies for 'landing zone', 'online' and 'corp' management groups that will ensure workloads will be secure, monitored, and protected according to best practices.

elements.name: lzSection
elements.label: Landing Zone Management Group

options.text: Select which of the the recommended policies you will assign to your landing zone management group.

elements.name: enableLzDdoS
elements.label: Enable DDoS Network Protection
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a connectivity subscription earlier, DDoS Network Protection will be enabled.
Uses the policy Virtual networks should be protected by Azure DDoS Protection Standard.

elements.name: enablePrivateDnsZonesForLzs
elements.label: Ensure private endpoints to Azure PaaS services are integrated with Azure Private DNS Zones in the corp connected landing zones
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected then Azure Policy will ensure private endpoints to Azure PaaS services are integrated with Azure Private DNS Zones in the connectivity subscription on behalf of the users.
Uses the custom initiative Configure Azure PaaS services to use private DNS zones.

elements.name: enableEncryptionInTransit
elements.label: Ensure encryption in transit is enabled for PaaS services
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected then Azure Policy will ensure PaaS resources uses TLS and SSL.
Uses the custom initiative Deny or Deploy and append TLS requirements and SSL enforcement on resources without Encryption in transit.

elements.name: enableVmMonitoring
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMs (Windows & Linux) and Azure Arc-enabled servers are being monitored
elements.toolTip:
Enabling this Azure Policy will ensure that every virtual machine (Windows, Linux, including Azure Arc enabled servers) are onboarded to Azure Monitor and Security.
Uses the initiative Enable Azure Monitor for VMs.

elements.name: enableVmssMonitoring
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMSS (Windows & Linux) are being monitored
elements.toolTip:
Enabling this Azure Policy will ensure that every virtual machine scale set (Windows & Linux) are onboarded to Azure Monitor and Security.
Uses the initiative Enable Azure Monitor for Virtual Machine Scale Sets.

elements.name: enableVmHybridMonitoring
elements.label: Ensure Hybrid VMs are being monitored
elements.toolTip: Enabling this Azure Policy will ensure that Azure Arc Enabled Hybrid VMs are monitored.

elements.name: enableAksPolicy
elements.label: Enable Kubernetes (AKS) for Azure Policy
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected the Azure Policy Add-on to manage and report on the compliance state of your Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters will be enabled.
Uses the policy Deploy Azure Policy Add-on to Azure Kubernetes Service clusters.

elements.name: denyAksPrivileged
elements.label: Prevent privileged containers in Kubernetes clusters
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, policy will be assigned to prevent privileged containers in AKS.
Uses the policy Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers.

elements.name: denyAksPrivilegedEscalation
elements.label: Prevent privileged escalation in Kubernetes clusters
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, policy will be assigned to prevent privileged escalations in AKS.
Uses the policy Kubernetes clusters should not allow container privilege escalation.

elements.name: denyHttpIngressForAks
elements.label: Ensure HTTPS ingress is enforced in Kubernetes clusters
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, HTTPS ingress will be required in AKS.
Uses the policy Kubernetes clusters should be accessible only over HTTPS.

elements.name: enableVmBackup
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMs (Windows & Linux) are enabled for Azure Backup
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and enable Azure Backup on all VMs in the landing zones.
Uses the policy Configure backup on virtual machines without a given tag to a new recovery services vault with a default policy.

elements.name: denyMgmtPorts
elements.label: Prevent inbound management ports from internet
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and prevent inbound management ports (22, 3389) from internet.
Uses the custom policy Management port access from the Internet should be blocked.

elements.name: denySubnetWithoutNsg
elements.label: Ensure subnets are associated with NSG
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure NSGs must be associated with subnets being created.
Uses the custom policy Subnets should have a Network Security Group.

elements.name: denyIpForwarding
elements.label: Prevent IP forwarding
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and prevent IP forwarding.
Uses the policy Network interfaces should disable IP forwarding.

elements.name: enableSqlEncryption
elements.label: Ensure Azure SQL is enabled with transparent data encryption
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected TDE will be enabled on all SQL instances.
Uses the policy Deploy SQL DB transparent data encryption.

elements.name: enableSqlThreat
elements.label: Ensure Azure SQL Threat Detection is enabled
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected Azure Defender will be enabled on all SQL instances.
Uses the policy Configure Azure Defender to be enabled on SQL servers.

elements.name: enableSqlAudit
elements.label: Ensure auditing is enabled on Azure SQL
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure auditing is enabled on Azure SQL.
Uses the policy Configure SQL servers to have auditing enabled to Log Analytics workspace.

elements.name: enableStorageHttps
elements.label: Ensure secure connections (HTTPS) to storage accounts
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure storage can only be accessed using HTTPS.
Uses the policy Secure transfer to storage accounts should be enabled.

elements.name: enforceKvGuardrails
elements.label: Enforce Key Vault recommended guardrails
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy Initiative will be assigned to ensure recommended Key Vault policies are enabled.
Uses the custom initiative Enforce recommended guardrails for Azure Key Vault..

elements.name: enforceBackup
elements.label: Enforce Backup and Recovery recommended guardrails
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy Initiative will be assigned to ensure recommended Azure Recovery Services policies are enabled.
Uses the custom initiative Enforce enhanced recovery and backup policies.

elements.name: auditAppGwWaf
elements.label: Audit WAF enabled on Application Gateways
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to audit whether WAF is enabled on Application Gateways.

options.text: You can optionally provide subscriptions for your first landing zones for both 'online' and 'corp' and choose to enable the assignment of recommended policies for the corp and online landing zones that will enable policies according to best practices.

elements.label: Connect corp landing zones to the connectivity hub (optional)?

elements.name: denyPublicEndpoints

elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected then Azure Policy will prevent PaaS resources to use public endpoints.

elements.name: denyPipOnNicForCorp
elements.label: Prevent usage of NICs with public IP(s) in the corp connected landing zones
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected then Azure Policy will prevent NICs with public IPs(s).

elements.name: denyHybridNetworking
elements.label: Deny the deployment of vWAN/VPN/ERs, including Gateways, to Subscriptions in the Corp Management Group
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected for Corp, vWAN/VPN/ER, including Gateways, will be blocked from deployment to the Corp Management Group.

elements.name: auditPeDnsZones
elements.label: Audit the deployment of Private Link Private DNS Zones in the Corp Management Group
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected an audit policy will be enabled for checking if any Private Link Private DNS Zones are deployed in subscriptions in the Corp Management Group.

options.text: There are no additional policy assignments for the online management group at this time, however, the online management group inherits and enforces the policies from the hierarchy above it.

steps.name: decommissionedSandboxZones
steps.label: Decommissioned/Sandbox
steps.bladeTitle: ALZ - Decommissioned and Sandbox Landing Zones Settings

options.text: You can optionally choose to enable the assignment of recommended policies for the Decommissioned and Sandbox landing zones that will enable policies according to best practices.

elements.name: decommSection
elements.label: Decommissioned Management Group

options.text:
The following policies will be enabled:
  • Deny the deployment of new resources
  • Deploy an auto VM shutdown policy at UTC 00:00

elements.name: enableDecommissioned
elements.label: Enforce ALZ Recommended policy controls on the Decommissioned Management Group?
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected for Decommissioned, the Enforce-ALZ-Decomm initiative will be applied to the Decommissioned Management Group.
Uses the custom initiative Enforce policies in the Decommissioned Landing Zone.

elements.name: sandboxSection
elements.label: Sandbox Management Group

options.text:
The following policies will be enabled:
  • Deny vNET peering across subscriptions
  • Deny the deployment of vWAN/ER/VPN gateways

elements.name: enableSandbox
elements.label: Enforce ALZ recommended policy controls on the Sandbox Management Group?
elements.toolTip:
If 'Yes' is selected for sandbox, the Enforce-ALZ-Sandbox initiative will be applied to the Sandbox Management Group.
Uses the custom initiative Enforce policies in the Sandbox Landing Zone.

options.text: You can optionally select one, or more, Regulatory Compliance built-in Policy Initiatives (Set Definitions) to assign to the Intermediate Root Management Group of your Azure Landing Zones hierarchy (e.g. Contoso).

link.label: See available initiatives and control mappings...

options.text: The Microsoft Cloud Security Benchmark (MCSB) is already assigned in to the Intermediate Root Management Group of your Azure Landing Zones hierarchy (e.g. Contoso). Click on this box to see the controls mapped for this initiative and also find in the TOC other Regulatory Compliance built-in Policy Initiatives (Set Definitions)

Azure Landing Zones makes a number of default Azure Policy Assignments that help bootstrap your environment to be able to host workloads in Application Landing Zones (Azure Subscriptions). Click on this box to see the default ALZ Policy Assignments

elements.name: regComplianceSelectorCheck
elements.label: Do you wish to assign additional Regulatory Compliance Policy Initiatives to your Azure Landing Zones Management Groups hierarchy?

options.text: Azure Landing Zones Management Group Hierarchy

You have selected a single platform Management Group and Subscripiton instead of a dedicated Subscriptions and Management Groups for the platform services. Please do not select the management, identity or connectivity Management Groups in the drop downs below as this will cause the deployment to fail.

Some Regulatory Compliance Policy Initiatives require specific parameter values to be set. Once you have selected the policies to assign and to which Management Group, please scroll down to provide any required parameter values. If you do not know the values for any of the required parameters requested below please leave them empty or enter a placeholder value and complete the ALZ deployment. You can then enter the Policy area in the Azure Portal once complete and edit the assignment parameter values at a later stage when you know the values. (click on this box to be taken to the Azure Policy Docs)
